This torrent works.
Tested it on 2010 MacBook Pro (2.4 GHz Core2Duo, Nvidia 320M, Windows 7 Home Premium 32bit, BootCamp).
It took a while to make it run, but it works.

Here are the steps I followed
1. Installed game using Revolt crack (Reloaded crack cause BSOD on my mac).
2. Changed to windowed mode to check for popups/errors (Go to MyDocuments->RockStar Games->Max Payne 3->graphics.xml. change fullscreen value to 0).
3. First error was a popup asking for Firewall access. Don't allow it.
4. Add a firewall rule to disable PlayMaxPayne.exe and MaxPayne.exe from connecting to internet. Otherwise you probably have to disconnect your net connection while playing.
5. Next there was an application force closing error. (this application was unable to start correctly). This error seemed to be related to Social Club and without resolving it, the game stucks at loading screen.
6. I updated Windows 7 using windows update and installed latest dot net framework.
7. The startup error  disappeared and on launching game, it logged automatically and now Im playing it :).
8. If all works well, then change back fullscreen value to 1 to play game in fullscreen.

Hope this helps all those who r stuck at loading screen.

Ok here is how you should install the game and play it (worked for me, flawlessly):

1) Run Setup

2) Select the "REVOLT" crack (atleast that worked for me)

3) Select language (English for me)

4) In one of the steps you will be prompted to select extra software to install (social club, direct x bla bla) MAKE SURE YOU INSTALL SOCIAL CLUB

5)  It takes upto 2hrs to install, which is fine considering you are getting a no shit game for free.

6) After install, to play the game, go to your install folder (the location on your HardDisk where you installed the game) and launch the gane using "PlayMaxPayne3.exe". 

7) DISCONNECT YOUR INTERNET CONNECTION DURING THE WHOLE PROCESS AND EVERY TIME YOU PLAY THE GAME.

If its still not working for you, just buy  the game or if you are too poor to buy, download the 26 gb version though I am pretty sure that won't work for you either. Sorry for my bad English, but who cares...

Tata, good luck

p.s.
* no virus, checked with Avira Professional suite (legit version)
